heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (215°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm) and pressure (down 7 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (91%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
